bibl.title: P. Hal. Inv. 31: Alexander and the Speaking Bird (cf. Ps.-Call., III, 28).
bibl.note: The text in P. Hal. Inv. 31 [ed.: Wolfgang LUPPE, Zwei literarische 'Warte'-Texte der Hallenser Papyrussammlung, ArchPF 37 (1991) pp. 7-8 et fig. 4] corresponds with one of the 'miracle letters' included in the Alexander-Romance (Ps.-Call., III, 27-28), more precisely with the account of Alexander's visit to the palace of Cyrus and Xerxes, where he finds a speaking bird. It provides us with one of the sources of Ps.-Callisthenes.
HUYS Marc and Alfons WOUTERS, P. Hal. Inv. 31: Alexander and the Speaking Bird (cf. Ps.-Call., III, 28).
